Effects of the rate of decay on ultrasonic wave transmission time in squirrel-damaged Luanta fir tree

Various degrees of wood decay in Luanta fir standing trees （Cunninghamia Konishii) damaged by squirrels were assessed. The propagation time of ultrasonic wave was measured using Pundit ultrasonic meter. Biological internal quality of standing trees could be evaluated by measuring the ultrasonic traversing time on the radial axis （in the 180 and 90° direction) of tree trunks. The ratio of traversing time in the 90° direction to radial （180°) direction tended to decrease with increased decay degree. However, the percentage of increase in transmission time tended to increase with increased decay degree. Results were compared with transmission times of healthy trees in the radial direction, and the ratio of transmission times in the different orientations as predictors of decay degree. The indicators verified that the internal decay of tree could be detected using ultrasonic measurement of the radial direction. Therefore, simultaneous measurement of the transmission time of ultrasonic wave by multiple transducers arranged around the stem in different orientations, the presence and size in the tree could be determined.

試驗以Pundit超音波測定儀在香杉立木（包含有目視建全立木及鼠害腐朽立木）胸高部位（130cm離地的高度）進行樹幹直徑（180°）及垂直方向（90°）測試，並記錄超音波穿透時間。立木測定完畢後，砍伐香杉檢測在相同部位樹幹實際腐朽率(%)Divos and Szalai（2002）指出評估材質的過程是基於測定一個方向時，比較存在測定傳播時間及參考值資料間的差異，其假定的學說是，在測定的傳播時間是高於10%的參考值資料時，則定義為缺點線，將垂直90°（T90）穿透時間與直徑180°（T180）方向穿透時間的比值（TR），作為本試驗評估的指標之一，其計算式如下TR = T90 / T180T90是測定樹幹橫斷面的垂直90°（T90）穿透時間，T180是測定樹幹橫斷面的直徑180°（T180）方向穿透時間，另外，資料分析方面，傳播時間的計算由Tm = Tr / D。Tm是單位長度的傳播時間（µs/m）。Tr是超音波讀取（穿透）時間（µs）。D 兩個轉換器間，測試方向的距離（m）。一般，利用傳播時間的增加率比較於參考值，以作為評估材質的基準，其傳播時間的增加率（△T）由(4) 式求出△T = (Tm − T0) / T0 × 100 (4)T0是傳播時間參考值資料。為了增加檢測的可靠性及確認內部腐朽的可能範圍，在實務上，可以引導多個測定（轉換器或感應器[transducer, channel,sensor]），在橫斷面的不同樹幹定位（方向）上。

台北植物園花曆植物開花照片

本資料集所描述的是智慧生態計畫－生態及生物多樣性資訊基礎建設與應用計畫自１０２年１１月底開始，以人工方式每周至台北植物園進行５５種花曆植物的開花程度調查與開花照片拍攝，並將資料介由台北植物源網絡平台管理後台將資料上傳，經過系統運算後，可同時於台北植物園網站(http://tpbg.tfri.gov.tw)與生態感測資料展示平台（http://iesn.tfri.gov.tw）上查閱，並以開放資料形式提供生態感測開放資料平台(http://iesn.tfri.gov.tw/forestDW/OpenData)作為資料來源之一。

Compositions and antioxidant activities of essential oils of different tissues from Cryptomeria japonica D. Don

Both hydrodistillation and headspace-GC methods were applied to extract essential oils from leaves, heartwood, sapwood, twig, and bark of Cryptomeria japonica D. Don and their chemical compositions determination and oil yields were analyzed. The antioxidant activities of these oils were also evaluated. The hydrodistillated leaves, heartwood, sapwood, twig, and bark essential oils contained 53, 44, 50, 87, and 60 identified compounds, respectively. Whereas the headspace methods separated from those parts 38, 35, 46, 61 and 46 identified compounds, respectively. Both methods showed similar main components and yields. The main composition of leaf essential were kaurene (19.1%), α-pinene (16.5%) and elemol (16.3%). Its heartwood oil had 1-epi-cubenol (18.9%), δ-cadinene (17.2%), andcubenol (14.9%) as the main ingredients; the sapwood oil contained cubebol (19.5%), cubenol (13.3%), 1-epi-cubenol (12.5%) and ferruginol (10.8%) as the main components; the bark oil, however, contained camphor (46.5%) and α-pinene (16.2%) etc.; and α-eudesmol (25.2%), γ-eudesmol (11.8%) in the twig oil. Essential oils from the leaves, heartwood, sapwood, and twigs of the species were predominately oxygenated sesquiterpenes, while the bark oil was mostly oxygenated monoterpenes. The antioxidant activities of these oils in a decreasing order was sapwood > twig > heartwood > bark > leaves. After TLC fractionation of the sapwood oil, we found that ferruginol had the highest antioxidant activity, and may be applicable as a natural antioxidant.

Extraction of essential oils and compositional and yield determinations-Hydrodistillation A kilogram each of the leaf, heartwood, sapwood, bark and twigs was placed in a round-bottom flask and added with 3 L of distilled water. The water was heated to boil and refluxed for 8 h. The essential oil layer above the water layer was separated and added with anhydrous sodium sulfate to dewater. The essential oils obtained were placed in specimen bottles and the yields determined. Each test was repeated three times and the data were averaged. Extraction of essential oils and compositional and yield determinations-GC and GC–MS Analysis A Hewlett-Packard HP 6890 gas chromatograph equipped with a DB-5 fused silica capillary column (30 m x 0.25 mm x 0.25 μm film thickness, J&W Scientific) and a FID detector was used for the quantitative determination of oil components. Oven temperature was programmed as follows: 50℃ for 2 min, rising to 250℃ at 5 ℃/min. Injector temperature: 270℃. Carrier gas: He with a flow rate of 1 mL/min. Detector temperature: 250℃, split ratio: 1:10. One μL sample was injected. Identification of the oil components was based on their retention indices and mass spectra, obtained from GC/MS analysis on a Hewlett-Packard HP 6890/HP5973 equipped with a DB-5 fused silica capillary column (30 m x 0.25 mm x 0.25 μm film thickness, J&W Scientific). The GC analysis parameters were the ones listed above and the MS was operating (full scan mode: scan time: 0.3 s, mass range was m/z 30-500) in the EI mode at 70 eV. All test data are the average of triplicate analyses. A Hewlett-Packard HP 6890 gas chromatograph equipped with a DB-5 fused silica capillary column (30 m x 0.25 mm x 0.25 μm film thickness, J&W Scientific) and a FID detector was used for the quantitative determination of oil components. Extraction of essential oils and compositional and yield determinations-HS-GC analysis The leaf, heartwood, sapwood, bark and twigs were cut into small pieces with scissors or a handsaw just prior to the headspace sampling. Each sample (20 mg) was filled into a 20 ml vial respectively, and then the vials were hermetically sealed with a PTFE-coated rubber septum and an aluminum cap. A Perkin Elemer Headspace Turbomatrix 40 unit connected to a Hewlett-Packard HP6890 GC was used for the analysis. The Headspace analysis programs and conditions were as follows: The vial oven temperature was 100℃ for each analysis as transfer line (110℃), and the needle temperature was 110℃. Treatment in oven with a shaker lasted 50 min. Pressurization time was 3.0 min; the thermostaiting time was 50 min; and the injection volume was 10 μl. The GC and GC-MS analysis programs used were the same as the above section. Each test was repeated three times and the data were averaged (Ho et al., 2008). A Perkin Elemer Headspace Turbomatrix 40 unit connected to a Hewlett-Packard HP6890 GC was used for the analysis. Oil yields determined by MHE method The total amount of oil in each sample was determined by HS-GC. Calibration curves were made with different quantities of different tissues essential oils previously obtained by hydrodistillation. A special quantitative method, MHE, was used. According to Kolb (1985) and Ho et al., (2008), the matrix effect can be eliminated by using the MHE method. The total area of each oil volume was calculated according to the following equation: ΣA = A12/(A1 – A2)……………………………………………… (a) Where: ΣA is the total area; A1 is the first area value; A2 is the second area volume from 2 successive chromatograms. HS-GC Identification of the components Identification of the leaf essential oil chemical constituents was based on comparisons of the peaks Retention indices (RI) (Van den Dool and Kratz, 1963), their retention times (RT), and mass spectra with those obtained from authentic standards and/or the NIST and Wiley libraries spectra and literature (Massada, 1976; Adams, 2001). DPPH (2,2-diphenyl-1-picrylhydrazyl) free radical scavenging capability test The method of Cuendet et al. (1997), Kirby and Schmidt (1997), Burits et al. (2001) and Ho et al. (2008) used for DPPH assay in this study. Fifty μL of various dilutions of the oils were mixed with 5 mL of a 0.004% methanol solution of DPPH. After an incubation period of 30 min, the absorbance of the samples was determined at 517 nm using a Jasco 7800 spectrophotometer. Tests were carried out in triplicates, and ascorbic acid was used as a positive control. TLC analysis and determination of the DPPH staining method After activating a 20 x 20 cm TLC plate, we dotted 3 μl of sapwood essential oil on the plate and developed the plate using a solution of hexane : ethyl acetate = 95 : 5. The plate was dried and observed under a UV light, and the color changes of the separated components were recorded. And then, the plate was immersed in the DPPH solution for 10 s. After drying, parts of the separated components would turn from purple to yellow, which was deduced to be the portions having free radical scavenging capabilities. GC-MS was then applied to the active separations to identify the compounds (Choi et al., 2002).

systematic wood anatomy of the Prunoideae (Rosaceae) in Taiwan

In this study, 13 species of Prunoideae plants in Taiwan were studied. The wood anatomical characters were analyzed with the cluster method to provide systematic evidence. Results showed that the general wood anatomical characters of the Prunoideae in Taiwan could be summarized as follows: growth rings distinct; vessels with a simple perforation plate and oblique end walls, intervessel pits alternate; fibrous cells with distinct bordered pits in radial wall and without septate fibers; axial parenchyma 1~3 gathered, apotracheal or scantly paratracheal; and rays both uniseriate and multiseriate, heterogeneous of types I and II. Results of the cluster analyses showed that the Taiwanese Prunoideae could be distinctly demarcated into two genera: Prinsepia and Prunus, which could be divided into 10 species. Therefore, Prunus phaeosticta var. phaeosticta and P. phaeosticta var. ilicifolia were confirmed to be the same species. Prunus takasagomontana and P. taiheiensis were proposed as being infraspecific taxa of P. transarisanensis, i.e., P. transarisanensis var. takasagomontana and P. transarisanensis f. taiheiensis, respectively. Prunus transarisanensis Hayata var. takasagomontana (Sasaki) Lu, Huang et Linn. stat. nov. is treated as a new form. In this paper, descriptions of the general features and microscopic characters of each species are presented. And a key is also provided for their identification.

一、材料本研究之材料以Lu et al.(2000)《臺灣樹木圖誌 第一卷》中所載之李亞科植物為鑑別依據，所有試材係採自臺灣本島及蘭嶼地區，計採得扁核木等13種李亞科植物，共62個木材樣本，各試材之採集地點及編號如Table 1。二、方法(一)木材永久切片製作(Sung 1960, Tsai 1991)依木材木理方向切出三軸正交之試材6塊，以壓力鍋盛水悶煮後，置於等量之50％乙醇(alcohol)及甘油(glycerol)混合液中軟化。利用滑動式切片機(sliding microtome, HM 400)切下厚度15~25 μm之橫(cross section, C.S.)、弦(tangential section, T.S.)、徑(radial section, R.S.)三切面切片，以0.5﹪番紅(safranin-O)酒精溶液染色，經脫水處理後製成永久切片，備觀察之用。(二)木材纖維解離法(Tsai 1991)切取包含完整早晚材之小木絲，試管內盛15條木絲及解離液(30﹪過氧化氫：蒸餾水：冰醋酸＝1：4：5)，並以鋁鉑紙密封置於56℃烘箱內，至木絲變成白色，再用蒸餾水將木絲清洗乾淨，供觀察、量測導管和纖維之用。(三)木材組織結構量測觀察並逢機取樣量測導管分子長度(vessel element length)、管孔弦向直徑(tangential diameter of vessel lumina)、導管側壁紋孔(intervessel pit)直徑、導管與木質線間(vessel-ray pit)紋孔直徑，纖維(fiber)長度以及木質線寬度(ray width)、高度(height)等。取樣數(N)以下列公式計算(Sheen 1999)：t：查表值CV：變異係數AE：誤差率(± 5﹪信賴度)取樣數(N)＝ 33.73，本研究將取樣數設為40。(四)木材解剖特徵觀察、記錄解剖特徵觀察項目，係依Wu (1980)、Barefoot and Hankins (1982)、Wang and Ding (1984)、Harada (1985)、Liao (1987)、IAWA Committee (1989)、Lu et al. (1990)、Saitoh et al. (1993)、Liao (1994)和Editorial Committee of Forest Products Industry Dictionary (2001)等之記載，詳予觀察、記錄與歸納。(五)顯微攝影利用顯微攝影設備(Nikon H-III, Nikon FDX-35)，拍攝各種倍率之相片，供參考對照。三、統計分析(一)數值表示與轉換所有量測之數據係利用統計分析套裝軟體SPSS 10.0，求得平均值95﹪的信賴區間， 。將單一植物體視為一個運算分類單位(operational taxonomic units, OTUs)，採用定量(quantitative)、二態(2-state qualitative)及多態定性(multi-state qualitative)特徵並加以量化。定量特徵之數值轉換係以九分法劃分其變異範圍，各以一位整數(1~9)表示，變異範圍中最大一級設定為9，最小一級設定為1。定性特徵之代碼轉換以0和10代表，未具該性狀者以0表示，該性狀出現者則以10計之，如Table 2 (Deng 2003)。(二)群團分析透過統計分析套裝軟體NTSYS-pc 2.01 (Rohlf 1993)進行群團分析(cluster analysis, CA)，採用歐基里德距離(Euclidean distance)公式：：表示i種與j種間之歐基里德距離， ：表示i種與j種第k項之值計算出各分類群間之距離，再以不加權配對算數平均數(unweighted pair group method with arithmetic mean, UPGMA)進行歸群分析及繪出樹枝圖(dendrogram)。以協表相關係數(cophenetic correlation coefficient)評估歸群結果的扭曲程度(Dum and Everitt 1982)。

Composition and antimicrobial and anti-wood-decay fungal activities of the leaf essential oils of Machilus pseudolongifolia from Taiwan

The hydrodistillated leaf essential oil of Machilus pseudolongifolia was analyzed to determine its composition and yield. Seventy compounds were identified, the main components being β-eudesmol (26.8%), α-cadinol (20.8%), viridiflorene (8.9%), α-caryophyllene (5.3%), globulol (4.6%) and β-caryophyllene (4.2%). Oxygenated sesquiterpenes (60.1%) and sesquiterpene hydrocarbons (31.4%) were the predominant groups of compounds. The leaf oil exhibited excellent antimicrobial and anti-wood-decay fungal activities.

Plant materials Fresh leaves of M. pseudolongifolia were collected in July 2008 from the Dahanshan at an elevation of 1200 m in southern Taiwan (N 23º 56´ 38˝, E 120º 53´ 19˝, Pingtung County). The samples were compared with specimen no. ou4393 from the Herbarium of National Chung-Hsing University and positively identified by Prof. Yen-Hsueh Tseng of NCHU. The voucher specimen (CLH-004) has been deposited in the NCHU herbarium. Leaves of the species were collected for subsequent extraction and analysis. Isolation of the leaf essential oil Leaves of M. pseudolongifolia (1Kg) were placed in a round-bottom flask and hydrodistilled for 8 h with 3 L of distilled water. The essential oil removed was dried with anhydrous sodium sulfate. The oil yield and all test data are the average of triplicate analyses. Essential oil analysis The method of Su et al. [22] was adopted. A Hewlett-Packard HP 6890 gas chromatograph equipped with a DB-5 fused silica capillary column (30 m x 0.25 mm x 0.25 μm film thickness, J&W Scientific) and a FID detector was used for the quantitative determination of oil components. Oven temperature was programmed as follows: 50ºC for 2 min, rising to 250ºC at 5 ºC/min. Injector temperature: 270ºC. Carrier gas: He with a flow rate of 1 mL/min. Detector temperature: 250ºC split ratio: 1:10. One μL sample was injected. Identification of the oil components was based on their retention indices and mass spectra, obtained from GC/MS analysis on a Hewlett-Packard HP 6890/HP5973 equipped with a DB-5 fused silica capillary column (30 m x 0.25 mm x 0.25 μm film thickness, J&W Scientific). The GC analysis parameters listed above and the MS were obtained (full scan mode: scan time: 0.3 s, mass range was m/z 30-500) in the EI mode at 70 eV. All data were the average of triplicate analyses. A Hewlett-Packard HP 6890 gas chromatograph equipped with a DB-5 fused silica capillary column (30 m x 0.25 mm x 0.25 μm film thickness, J&W Scientific) and a FID detector was used for the quantitative determination of oil components. Component identification Identification of the leaf essential oil constituents was based on comparisons of retention index (RI) [23], retention times (RT), and mass spectra with those obtained from authentic standards and/or the NIST and Wiley libraries spectra, and literature [8,24] Antimicrobial activity The in vitro antibacterial and antifungal activities of the oil were evaluated by the disc diffusion method using Mueller-Hinton agar for bacteria and Sabouraud dextrose agar for fungi [25]. Discs containing 15 μL and 30 μL of the oil, which was dissolved in dimethylsulphoxide (DMSO), were placed on the inoculated plates with test microorganisms. Growth inhibition zones (including disc diameter of 6 mm) were measured after 24 h and 48 h of incubation at 37°C and 24°C for bacteria and fungi, respectively. Gentamicine and tetracycline for bacteria, and nystatine for fungi were used as positive controls [9, 10, 26]. Anti-wood-decay fungal assays The method of Su et al. [28] was adopted.The fungi used were Trametes versicolor (L. ex Fr.) Quel. (BCRC 35253), Phanerochaete chrysosporium Burdsall (BCRC 36200), Phaeolus schweinitzii (Fries) Paterson (BCRC 35365) and Laetiporus sulphureus (B. ex Fr.) Bond. (BCRC 35305). Microbial strains were obtained from the Culture Collection and Research Center of the Food Industry Research and Development Institute, Hsinchu City, Taiwan. Anti-wood-decay fungal assays were carried out in triplicate and the data were averaged. Different concentrations of the essential oil (12.5, 25, 50, 75 and 100 μg/mL) were added to sterilized potato dextrose agar (PDA). The test plates were incubated at 27℃. When the mycelium of fungi reached the edge of the control plate, the anti-wood-decay fungal index was calculated as follows: Anti-wood-decay fungal index (%)= (1–Da/Db)X100 where Da is the diameter of the growth zone in the experimental dish (cm) and Db is the diameter of the growth zone in the control dish (cm).

鬼針屬雜草新生物型-屏東小白花鬼針草
鬼針屬植物為世界性的雜草，台灣最常見為大花咸豐草，其次是白花鬼針及小白花鬼針，本研究之試驗材料為小白花鬼針及採集自屏東之屏東小白花鬼針，經過三年的持續觀察確認為屏東小白花鬼針為小白花鬼針天然所產生之變異，主要特徵為葉子呈現非均質性白化，可作為觀賞之用途。

Content: 研究材料中屏東小白花鬼針及對照組小白花鬼針，採自屏東市復光街6-2號未施農藥之空地，後移植於全光照之空地，觀察時間為2003年3月至95年6月間，觀察間隔為每兩個月觀察乙次，觀察項目植株是存活及葉部斑點之有無，另大花咸豐草採自台北植物園。

Geochemical characterization of placic horizons in subtropical montane forest soils, northeastern Taiwan

Well-developed placic horizons have been found in subalpine forest soils with large clay contents in Taiwan. We investigated their formation processes in five profiles in a subalpine ecosystem of northeastern Taiwan, using scanning electron microscopy (SEM), energy-dispersive spectrometry (EDS), electron probe microanalysis (EPMA), differential X-ray diffraction (DXRD) and chemical extractions. The placic horizons, ranging from 3- to 17-mm thick, always occurred above argillic horizons with abrupt changes in pH and texture between the two horizons. When fully developed, the placic horizons were clearly differentiated between upper and lower sub-horizons. EDS and chemical extractions revealed that the cementing materials in both were predominantly inorganic Fe oxides. However, contents of aluminosilicates and organically complexed Fe and Al were greater in the lower than in the upper placic sub-horizon. Results of EPMA indicated that interstitial fine materials in the upper placic sub-horizon were composed mainly of Fe oxides, whereas Fe oxides were codominant with illuvial clay in the lower sub-horizon. These analyses identified the migration of Fe and clay as major formation processes in both sub-horizons. We hypothesize that there is a pedogenic sequence that starts with clay illuviation, followed by podzolization. The resultant textural and permeability differentiation reinforces the tendency to profile episaturation that is already inherent from the heavy rainfall and clayey surface soils. Topsoil Fe is therefore reduced and mobilized, and then illuviated with clay and organically complexed Fe/Al to initiate the lower placic sub-horizon. The poor permeability of this layer reinforces the moisture conditions in the surface soils, and the further reduction, illuviation and deposition of inorganic Fe to form the upper placic sub-horizon.

The study was conducted on Taiping Mountain (24◦32N, 121◦56E) in northeastern Taiwan (Figure 1). The profiles studied were located from 1800 to 2100 m above sea level near a subalpine lake, Lake Tsuifeng. Taiping Mountain was formed by tectonic uplift in the Miocene and is mainly composed of shale and slate (Ho, 1988). Mean annual air temperature at the study site is approximately 10◦C (monthly maximum temperature is approximately 24◦C in August and monthly minimum is 4◦C in February), and total annual precipitation is approximately 3200 mm (Wu & Chen, 2005). Heavy rainfall in the monsoon season (July to November) can lead to high water levels in the lake and even inundate the footslope site in the study area. Subalpine forests with Taiwan red cypress (Chamaecyparis formosensis Matsum), Taiwan Chinese fir (Taiwania cryptomerioides Hay.) and Willow fir (Cryptomeria japonica Hassk.) are the dominant vegetation. Silver grass (Miscanthus transmorrisonensis Hay.) and aquatic plants (Schoenoplectus mucronatus) are dominant in the shore areas of the lake.

TWO NEW SPECIES OF BREDIA (MELASTOMATACEAE) FROM TAIWAN

An examination of living material of Bredia (Melastomataceae) in Taiwan and a comparison with herbarium material of the genus from eastern Asia (China, Japan and Taiwan) has led to the recognition of two new species, B. dulanica C.L.Yeh, S.W.Chung & T.C.Hsu and B. laisherana C.L.Yeh & C.R.Yeh. The morphology and diagnostic characters of these two species are described and illustrated and a key to the species of Bredia in Taiwan is given.

Establishment and application for empirical equations of exponential type to estimate design hyetographs

In this study, theoretical analyses of empirical equation of exponential type to estimate design hyetographs, verification of these type equations, and application of empirical equations of design hyetographs in Taiwan were carried out. An example of estimating 24-hour duration design hyetograph at Shanping of Taiwan was presented. ( published in Journal of slopeland hazard prevention, 4(1):1-10, 2005, Establishment and application for empirical equations of exponential type to estimate design hyetographs )

Composition of the leaf oils of Prunus phaeosticta var. phaeosticta from Taiwan

The leaf essential oils of Prunus phaeosticta var. phaeosticta were isolated analyzed using hydrodistillation and headspace-GC methods to determine their composition and yield. Seventy-six compounds were identified in the hydrodistilled leaf oil, and 58 compounds were identified by the headspace, respectively using GC and GC/MS. The main components of the oils were benzaldehyde (73.3%), 1,8-cineole (5.4%) and α-terpinyl acetate (4.4%).

Plant MaterialsThe fresh leaves of P. phaeosticta var. phaeosticta were collected from Taiwan Forestry Research Institute Lienhuachih Research Center in central Taiwan where a specimen has been deposited in the herbarium, in May 2006. Leaves of the species were collected for subsequent oil isolation and analysis.Hydrodistillation extractionA kilogram of the leaves of P. phaeosticta var. phaeosticta was placed in a round-bottom flask and 3 L of distilled water poured in. Hydrodistillated for 8 h and the oil removed from the partitioned water layer. Anhydrous sodium sulfate was added to dewater. The yield of oil was determined. All test data are the average of triplicate analysesGC and GC/MS analysesA Hewlett-Packard HP 6890 gas chromatograph equipped with a DB-5 fused silica capillary column (30 m x 0.25 mm x 0.25 μm film thickness, J&W Scientific) and a FID detector was used for the quantitative determination of oil components. Oven temperature was programmed as follows: 50℃ for 2 min, rising to 250℃ at 5 ℃/min. Injector temperature: 270℃. Carrier gas: He with a flow rate of 1 mL/min. Detector temperature: 250℃, split ratio: 1:10. One μL sample was injected. Identification of the oil components was based on their retention indices and mass spectra, obtained from GC/MS analysis on a Hewlett-Packard HP 6890/HP5973 equipped with a DB-5 fused silica capillary column (30 m x 0.25 mm x 0.25 μm film thickness, J&W Scientific). The GC analysis parameters were the ones listed above and the MS was operating (full scan mode: scan time: 0.3 s, mass range was m/z 30-500) in the EI mode at 70 eV. All test data are the average of triplicate analysesA Hewlett-Packard HP 6890 gas chromatograph equipped with a DB-5 fused silica capillary column (30 m x 0.25 mm x 0.25 μm film thickness, J&W Scientific) and a FID detector was used for the quantitative determination of oil componentsComponent identificationIdentification of the leaf oil constituents was based on comparisons of the peaks Retention indices (RI), their retention times (RT), and mass spectra with those obtained from authentic standards and/or the NIST and Wiley libraries spectra and literature .

A Five-year Trade Dependence Analysis of Forest Products Between Taiwan and China

In 2003, Mainland China occupied 15.73% of the total importation value of forest products in Taiwan, and became the 3rd largest source of imported forest products (IFP). Since 1990, the growth rates of IFP values from mainland China are increasing, and higher than that from the global market. It indicated the trend dependence is increasing. The growth rate of IFP values from mainland China has increased to 9.56% in 2003. Four major categories, which dominated the 93.19% of the IFP market share from mainland China, are ordered by the market share as following: wooden & rattan furniture (39.53%), veneer & plywood (20.82%), pulp (17.18%), and wooden & rattan products (15.66%). The trend of that market has shifted from raw materials to semi-products or finished products. Although the trend of trade dependence in imported forest products between Taiwan and mainland China is increasing in current few years, the value of trade dependence decreased sharply since 1998. The structural dependence explained the increasing of trade dependence between Taiwan and Mainland China before 1997, and no obvious reason was recognized the trade dependence increasing during 1998-2003. The research indicated the trend of trade dependence between Taiwan and mainland China has shifted from structural dependence to relative interest dependence.

Pioneer and Alien Tree Species Invade Banana Bay Coast Forest Reserve, Kenting National Park, Southern Taiwan

Banana Bay Coast Forest Reserve, 28 ha on area located at Kenting of southern Taiwan, is the only tropical coast forest reserve in Taiwan. Taiwan Forestry Research Institute set up a 1.458 ha (270 m x 54 m) plot in1974 and re-inventoried in 2005 for monitoring the tree species (dbh≧4 cm) dynamics among period of 31 years. The purpose of this study is to clarify if any and how the pioneer and alien tree species invade this coast forest remnant? For clearly explaining the spatial pattern of species distribution, the plot was divided into 3 parallel transects named road-transect, mid-transect and sea-transect. Two pioneer tree species, Macaranga tanarius and Melanolepis multiglandulosa, were recorded; and each of them had 240 and 84 individuals in 2005. It’s 61 and 3.5 times of 1974’s recorded individuals. More pioneer trees distributed in road-transect than in mid-transect, and few in sea-transect in 2005, so it seem the pioneer tree spread from the road to forest interior. More than 100 Leucaena leucocephala, an alien tree species which not found in the plot in 1974, were recorded in 2005,; however, most of them still concentrated at the corner of road-transect, not invaded into the forest interior. This coast forest remnant was sparsely cover by pioneer tree in 1974, nevertheless about half of area significantly invaded by pioneer and alien tree in 2005. Basing on the composition change on temporal and spatial scale, this remnant coast forest will probably seriously corroded by the invasion of pioneer and alien tree. Conservation research and management enforcement such as forest dynamics monitoring, invasive species eradiation, revegetation of old-growth species need to be done for sustaining this coast forest remnant reserve.

花蓮七星潭海岸防風林功效之探討

七星潭位於花蓮機場東側，為一新月形海灣，經縣政府劃定為風景特定區，以提供民眾 遊憩所需。為了解七星潭海岸防風林之功效，本研究以多層風速計與微氣候記錄儀觀測林帶 內外風速、鹽份及微氣候之差異；經由研究結果得知，位於防風林帶內67m 處平均減風與減 鹽效果已達70%左右，而至140m 處則可高達約90%；再者，葉片與土壤鹽份量及空中飄鹽 量之分佈，隨水平距離增加而遞減，在150m 處皆已降至10 mg/100ml 以下；至於林帶內平 均氣溫與地溫則較林帶外高約2℃，土壤含水量較林帶外高約0.4%，而氣壓及相對濕度亦有 相同之趨勢，但光照度則僅為林帶外1/215，輻射亦只有1/20；整體而言，由於海岸防風林 帶具有調節微氣候之功效，因此在冬季期間，林帶內感覺溫暖而舒適，對於營造提供優質的 天然遊憩環境有實質助益。

.風速剖面測定為瞭解防風林帶對風速之影響，研究中使用魯賓遜風杯型多層風速計，從事風速觀測，每套風速計共有5 組風杯，所以每一觀測點可同時測得5 個不同高度之風速資料，藉此可用以分析垂直方向之風速剖面。根據Prandtl 理論，風速剖面為一對數分布型態，因此，風速觀測時於對照點與各觀測點上分別設立多層風速計，如圖2 所示，同時測定地面上0.5m、1.5m、3.0m、4.6m 及6.0m 五個不同高度之風速資料，如圖3 所示；由於風具有陣性，故依世界氣象組織之規定，採用10 分鐘之平均風速，即每10分鐘同時記錄一次，並換算成單位為m/s之風速值；各觀測點重複測定三次，再取三次風速之平均，以作為該觀測點之平均風速值。實驗中，在防風林帶迎風面選擇一處不受林帶影響之空曠區，設置對照點，所測得的風速視為標準風速；另外沿主風向距離防風林帶之迎風面67m及140m 處，則分別設立兩個觀測點，如圖2 所示；觀測點Ⅰ與觀測點Ⅱ之林帶疏密度，如圖4至圖5 所示，經由Image-Pro 軟體處理後，所得結果分別為62.8%及93.7%。為瞭解防風林帶對風速之影響，研究中使用魯賓遜風杯型多層風速計，從事風速觀測，每套風速計共有5 組風杯，所以每一觀測點可同時測得5 個不同高度之風速資料，藉此可用以分析垂直方向之風速剖面。根據Prandtl 理論，風速剖面為一對數分布型態，因此，風速觀測時於對照點與各觀測點上分別設立多層風速計，如圖2 所示，同時測定地面上0.5m、1.5m、3.0m、4.6m 及6.0m 五個不同高度之風速資料，如圖3 所示；由於風具有陣性，故依世界氣象組織之規定，採用10 分鐘之平均風速，即每10分鐘同時記錄一次，並換算成單位為m/s之風速值；各觀測點重複測定三次，再取三次風速之平均，以作為該觀測點之平均風速值。實驗中，在防風林帶迎風面選擇一處不受林帶影響之空曠區，設置對照點，所測得的風速視為標準風速；另外沿主風向距離防風林帶之迎風面67m及140m 處，則分別設立兩個觀測點，如圖2 所示；觀測點Ⅰ與觀測點Ⅱ之林帶疏密度，如圖4至圖5 所示，經由Image-Pro 軟體處理後，所得結果分別為62.8%及93.7%。空中飄鹽量測定(1)將密度為20 支紗之紗布，以圓環套筒固定於壓克力鹽份收集框上，再將收集框固定於距離地面高0.4m、1.4m、2.9m、4.4m 及5.9m 之多層風速計鋁桿上，如圖2 所示；壓克力圓筒方向與風向平行，以測定不同高度之鹽份量。(2)觀測時間為1 小時，同時記錄風速資料後，將紗布卸下，裝入塑膠袋攜回室內分析；將攜回之紗布以鑷子放置於廣口甁內， 加入100c.c 蒸餾水浸泡24 小時，以SUNTEX SC-17A 電導度計測定廣口瓶中之電導度值，再將所得之值，依率定曲線（如圖6 所示）換算成單位體積所含鹽份之毫克數。葉片鹽份量測定為瞭解飄鹽在防風林帶內分布情形，故於林帶之迎風面每隔20m 設立一處葉片鹽份採樣點，共設立12 個點，如圖2 所示。每個採樣點之採樣高約1.5m，將採集之木麻黃葉片樣本置於塑膠袋中，攜回實驗室分別放置燒杯中，各加入100c.c 蒸餾水浸泡24 小時，再以電導度計進行葉面鹽份附著量測定，所得結果用以分析空中飄鹽量在林帶內消減之情形。土壤鹽份量測定在葉片採樣點1 至10 處再從事土壤採樣，每處分別取0～10cm、10～20cm 及20～30cm三個不同深度之土壤樣本，攜回實驗室進行土壤鹽份量測定；將所攜回之土樣秤重50g，投入廣口瓶中，注入蒸餾水，土樣與蒸餾水之混合比為1：1，調製成之懸浮液放置三天後，以電導度計測定其電導度值，並依率定曲線換算成單位體積所含鹽份之毫克數，所得結果進而與空中飄鹽量、葉面鹽份量互相比對，以瞭解彼此間之關連性。微氣候觀測為能進一步瞭解防風林帶內外微氣候之差異，因而再進行林帶內外溫度、溼度、氣壓、最高最低溫度、光照度、日輻射、土壤水分及地溫等微氣候因子之觀測，分析比較林帶內外微氣候之變化，以提供防風林營造及濱海休憩娛樂區開發之參考。溫度、濕度、氣壓及日輻射之觀測，係使用自記式記錄器，而最高最低溫度與光照度之觀測則是使用非自記式儀表，至於土壤水分與地溫之觀測則是使用CR10X記錄器配合量測感應器，同時蒐集土深10cm、20cm、30cm、40cm 及50cm 處之資料，如圖7 所示，測定時以每30 秒讀取資料1 次，再取30 分鐘之平均值，此種取樣與量測方式將能符合夏禹久、楊之遠(1989)與梁亞忠(1994)所要求之穩定狀態。

花蓮七星潭海岸防風林功效之探討
Preservation and mildew control of wood materials

木材本身是一種高分子有機聚合體，構成其主成分的纖維素、半纖維素與木質素等極易受到外在環境因子的生物如腐朽菌、昆蟲等危害，此結果不但降低了木材的使用價值，也造成了極鉅的生命財產損失。 以銅、鉻、砷元素為主的鉻化砷酸銅（Chromated Copper Arsenate, CCA）是一種全世界普遍使用的木材防腐藥劑，其效用可使木材在大部分的環境下免於昆蟲與腐朽菌的危害。然而，由於環境污染的問題，近年來這些防腐藥劑在有些國家已經被禁止使用。因此，不含鉻與砷的防腐藥劑與低污染性的防腐藥劑如銅烷基銨化合物（Alkaline Copper Quats, ACQ）與當耐力CY（Tanalith CY, TCY）等在美國已逐步的被開發與應用。銅烷基銨化合物與當耐力CY處理材之耐腐朽性與抗白蟻性是由於其藥劑中之金屬離子在木材中產生固著或沉澱，因此其藥劑之淋溶性亦將影響到環境之污染問題。然而，迄今並無標準之試驗方法來評估此類防腐藥劑之固著性，因此在此類防腐藥劑應用於我國木材加工業前，實有必要瞭解其處理材之耐腐朽性、抗白蟻性與藥劑淋溶性，以降低或減少其對於環境之影響。所以，本研究擬進行銅烷基銨化合物與當耐力CY處理材之室內與田野試驗，由試驗結果可以提供我國木材加工業生產更符合環保與安全性之木製品。又木材極易受到環境溫濕度影響，且無法避免遭受霉菌等微生物之危害，因而產生腐朽並降低木材之品質，本研究計畫擬採用聚對二甲苯（polypara-xylylenes）真空鍍膜技術與幾丁聚醣塗裝等方法以進行木材表面處理，期能藉由高分子聚合物之沉積於木材表面，以改善木質材料之吸濕性與易滋生霉菌等缺點，藉以達到改善木材表面性質之目的，進而確保持木製的綠色產品能長保如新之目標，克服木材表面之霉害劣化，進而延長其使用年限。

Content: Dr.Chin-YinHwangTaiwan Forestry Reserach InstituteSenior Scientist53 Nan-Hai RdTaipeiTaiwan100ROC886-2-23039978#3723886-2-23077306chinyin@tfri.gov.tw

新型水溶性木材防腐藥劑之效能及其對於環境之影響1.腐朽及蟲害情形之檢測：定期前往福山、蓮華池與中埔等三研究中心進行取樣各種處理材5支，觀測與紀錄各種處理試材外表遭受腐朽及蟲害情形。2.重量損失率測定：將前述試材攜回試驗室，並將其放置於105℃烘箱乾燥一天後，放置於乾燥皿中冷卻，測定其重量之減輕量。3.重金屬流失率測定：將前述乾燥試材以粉碎機打成粉末，再秤量1g木粉並壓製成圓盤，而後再以x射線元素測試儀測定其重金屬含量變化情形。4.靜曲強度試驗：以萬能強度試驗機測試各處理材埋置後經時之力學性質變化情形。x射線元素測試儀、萬能強度試驗機。幾丁聚醣應用於木質材料霉害防除之探討1.幾丁聚醣處理木材之防霉性能評估：取實際篩選、純化之各種木材表面最具代表性之霉菌菌株（ Aspergillus niger, Aspergillus flavus, Trichoderma viride），分別接種於各試驗材料表面，而後將處理後之試材置入25℃培養箱中，以PDA培養基進行霉菌培養試驗，藉以評估各種防霉藥劑之抗霉效能。2.幾丁聚醣處理試材耐久性之評估：分為室內人工試驗及戶外曝露試驗方式進行耐久性評估。3.幾丁聚醣處理木材之性質分析與測定：包括：顏色變化、、接觸角、顯微結構、防霉性能、表面化學官能基之評估與分析。人工耐候試驗機、紅外線光譜儀、色差計、接觸角計、掃描式電子顯微鏡。聚對二甲苯鍍膜處理應用於木材表面性質之改良1.適用於木材表面處理聚對二甲苯種類之篩選及最佳鍍膜膜厚之評估。2.鍍膜處理材之顏色變化、潤性能（接觸角）、顯微結構、化學官能基之分析與測定。3.聚對二甲苯鍍膜處理試材耐久性之評估：分為室內人工試驗（UVB-313燈管加速照光劣化）及戶外曝露試驗方式進行耐久性評估。人工耐候試驗機、紅外線光譜儀、色差計、接觸角計。
Temporal effect of CCA, ACQ, TCY preservative on bending strength (MOR) of Chinese fir (CUN) and Japanese fir (J) after 30- month field exposure.
Temporal effect of CCA, ACQ, TCY preservative on bending strength (MOR) of Chinese fir (CUN) and Japanese fir (J) after 30- month field exposure.
CP, LW, and FS are abbreviation for experiment sites in the Chung-Pu, Lien-Hua-Chih, and Fu-Shan Research Centers of TFRI.
duration of field exposure in months
CCA (Chromated Coper Arsenate, ACQ(Ammoniacal Coper Quats), TCY(Tanalith CY)
concentration of the preservatives in percentage

新型水溶性木材防腐藥劑之效能及其對於環境之影響1.腐朽及蟲害情形之檢測：定期前往福山、蓮華池與中埔等三研究中心進行取樣各種處理材5支，觀測與紀錄各種處理試材外表遭受腐朽及蟲害情形。2.重量損失率測定：將前述試材攜回試驗室，並將其放置於105℃烘箱乾燥一天後，放置於乾燥皿中冷卻，測定其重量之減輕量。3.重金屬流失率測定：將前述乾燥試材以粉碎機打成粉末，再秤量1g木粉並壓製成圓盤，而後再以x射線元素測試儀測定其重金屬含量變化情形。4.靜曲強度試驗：以萬能強度試驗機測試各處理材埋置後經時之力學性質變化情形。x射線元素測試儀、萬能強度試驗機。幾丁聚醣應用於木質材料霉害防除之探討1.幾丁聚醣處理木材之防霉性能評估：取實際篩選、純化之各種木材表面最具代表性之霉菌菌株（ Aspergillus niger, Aspergillus flavus, Trichoderma viride），分別接種於各試驗材料表面，而後將處理後之試材置入25℃培養箱中，以PDA培養基進行霉菌培養試驗，藉以評估各種防霉藥劑之抗霉效能。2.幾丁聚醣處理試材耐久性之評估：分為室內人工試驗及戶外曝露試驗方式進行耐久性評估。3.幾丁聚醣處理木材之性質分析與測定：包括：顏色變化、、接觸角、顯微結構、防霉性能、表面化學官能基之評估與分析。人工耐候試驗機、紅外線光譜儀、色差計、接觸角計、掃描式電子顯微鏡。聚對二甲苯鍍膜處理應用於木材表面性質之改良1.適用於木材表面處理聚對二甲苯種類之篩選及最佳鍍膜膜厚之評估。2.鍍膜處理材之顏色變化、潤性能（接觸角）、顯微結構、化學官能基之分析與測定。3.聚對二甲苯鍍膜處理試材耐久性之評估：分為室內人工試驗（UVB-313燈管加速照光劣化）及戶外曝露試驗方式進行耐久性評估。人工耐候試驗機、紅外線光譜儀、色差計、接觸角計。

Analysis of Carbon Sequestration and Carbon Dioxide Reduction by Post and Beam Wooden Construction Buildings in Taiwan

The objective of this study was to evaluate the CO2 emission and carbon sequestration under the post and beam (PNB) wooden construction buildings in Taiwan. A total of 53 PNB wooden construction buildings were selected for calculating the CO2 emission, which generated from construction materials’ energy consumption. The results indicated that the usage of wood materials in per unit construction area was 0.2090 m3/m2; the CO2 emission in per unit construction area were 47.47 kg/m2. By comparing the wooden construction to reinforced concrete (RC) and steel prefabricated (S) construction, the CO2 emission reduction of the wooden construction can reach 387.71 kg/m2 and 338.55 kg/m2, respectively. The results clearly proved the PNB wooden construction buildings have significances in CO2 reduction and carbon sequestration.

利用葉綠體DNA序列探討菲律賓樟之分類地位

菲律賓樟(Cinnamomum philippinense)在分類上隸屬樟科，曾被歸類於楨楠屬(Machilus)與酪梨屬(Persea)。本研究利用植物葉綠體DNA中的PetD~PetB基因間序列、TrnV~TrnM序列以及TrnS~TrnT序列分析菲律賓樟與樟屬、楨楠屬以及酪梨屬之親緣關係，以確定菲律賓樟的分類歸屬及楨楠屬和酪梨屬的關係。上述3個葉綠體DNA片段的定序結果顯示菲律賓樟較靠近楨楠屬，在3個片段多達31處變異處可供辨識的位置上菲律賓樟與楨楠屬植物序列之間沒有任何變異，而兩者與樟樹有15處發生序列變異或插入缺失，與酪梨亦有14處發生變異或缺失。菲律賓樟在遺傳距離上與楨楠屬植物之距離為0.00，與樟樹為0.006，與酪梨為0.004。Neighbor joining以及maximum parsimony之分析方式都可得三個分群:第一群包含樟樹、香桂；第二群將菲律賓樟與楨楠屬植物聯結在一起；第三群則將酪梨獨立於楨楠屬旁，另月桂為外群。在外部形態方面，經過標本比對採自菲律賓呂宋島初島住彥，所提供的菲律賓樟的標本 與台灣地區所產的菲律賓樟外部形態相同，台灣產的與菲律賓產的應可處理為同一分類群。根據菲律賓樟的種子外形表面有斑紋及其生理特性與一般之楨楠屬相近，支持本研究將菲律賓樟歸併到楨楠屬，成為菲律賓楠(Machilus philippinensis Merr.)。楨楠屬和酪梨屬仍有些遺傳距離，樹狀圖分析結果並不互相隸屬，或許可視為相互獨立的兩個屬或是組。

參試材料本研究之菲律賓樟(Cinnamomum philippinense (Merr.) Chang)台灣的主要產地在高雄縣六龜鄉，另外還分布嘉義縣以南地區。因本種在分類處理上曾被處理為楨楠屬(Machilus)、樟屬(Cinnamomum)以及酪梨屬(Persea)。本試驗以分布廣泛的紅楠(Machilus thunbergii Sieb & Zucc.)、香楠(M. zuihoensis Hayata)、日本楨楠(M. japonica Sieb. & Zucc)代表楨楠屬，以樟樹(Cinnamomum camphora L.) 代表樟屬(Cinnamomum)之樟組植物，以香桂(C. subavenium Miq.)代表樟屬之肉桂組植物，以酪梨(Persea americana Mill.) 代表Persea屬，用月桂(Laurus nobilis L.)作群外對照。材料來源見table。DNA萃取方法抽取葉片DNA步驟參照Doyle and Doyle(1990)的CTAB法，並稍作修改。取新鮮材料樣本100 mg加入400 ul的2X CTAB(2% CTAB, 104 M NaCl, 20 mM EDTA, Tris HCl(pH8.0)100 mM , β-Mercaptoethanol)，以萃取DNA。再以酒精沉澱DNA，最後將DNA溶於TE溶液之中備用，並以Gene Quant II核酸計算儀測DNA濃度以定量。Reference:Dolye, J. J. and J. L. Doyle. 1990. Isolation of plant DNA from fresh tissue. Focue 12: 13-15.葉綠體DNA基因間區間序列本試驗所使用的葉綠體DNA參試的引子共3對。產生可辨識位點的引子有3對序列，其黏合溫度皆為55°C:第一對引子PetD~PetB序列為5'-GCGGGCTCTCCATAATAAT-3'和5-ACGCGGAAGTGTTAGTGTGGG-3'；第二對TrnV~TrnM序列為5'-GCTATACGGGCTCGAACC-3'和5'-TACCTACTATTGGATTTGAACC-3'；第三對為TrnS~TrnT序列為5'-CATAACCTTGAGGTCA CGGG-3'和5'-AACCACTCGGCCATCTCT CCTA-3'(Demesure et al., 1995)。Reference:Demesure, B. N., Sodzi and R. J. Petit. 1995. A set of universal primers for amplification of polymorphic non-coding regions of mitochondrial and chloroplast DNA in plants. Mol. Ecol. 4: 129-131.PCR之反應條件及步驟PCR反應液含有以下各成分: 總體積50 ul內含60 ng的DNA模板，3 uM核酸引子(各含1.5 uM)、4 mM MgCl2、3mM dNTPs(包含dATP、dTTP、dCTP、dGTP)及1.5U之Taq DNA polymerase(Life Technologies)。PCR反應以德國Biometra 2000之溫度循環器(T3 Thermocycler)進行，採用之溫度週期及流程如下：1.先以94°C處理5分鐘，使雙股DNA變性。2.再以92°C(變性溫度)45秒，55°C(鏈合溫度)45秒，72°C(延展溫度)1分30秒，進行35-40次的擴增循環。3.最後保持72°C處理10分鐘。4.反應物溫度降至室溫。先取出5 ul之PCR產物進行確認，其餘PCR產物則以ABI自動定序儀進行定序，PCR及定序各進行2-3次以進行確認序列之重複性。葉綠體DNA定序資料分析葉綠體DNA之3個片段，定序結果以Bioedit軟體進行排序(Multiple Sequence Alignment)。遺傳距離矩陣以Kimura's 2-parameter(Kimura, 1980)方法進行演算，將已完成的序列，進行兩兩比較，計算序列問發生取代變異的比例，以此比例為演化距離值。分子資料之距離矩陣及建構樹狀圖以MEGA軟體3.0版(Kumar and Nei, 2004)進行演算。本研究採用Neighbor joining法(簡稱NJ)(Saitou and Nei, 1987)，為距離矩陣法中，被廣泛使用的方法。NJ方法並不假設演化速率相等，所以獲得的樹狀圖並非齊頭式。另外，最大簡約法(Maximum parsimony，簡稱MP)由重複的次數中搜尋最簡約樹，並採用靴帶(Bootstrap)分析法對每個節(node)進行1000次顯著性測試，計算建構親緣關係樹譜的可信度(Felsenstein, 1985)。Reference:Kimura, M. 1980. A simple method for estimating evolutionary rates of base substitution through comparative studies of nucleotide sequences. J. Mol. Evol. 16: 111-120.Kumar, S. K. and T. Nei. 2004. MEGA 3: Integrated Software for Molecular Evolution Genetics Analysis and Sequence Alignment Briefings in Bioinformatics 5: 150-163.Saitou, N. and M. Nei. 1987. The neighbor-joining method: a new method for reconstructing phylogenetic rees. olecular Biology and Evolution 4: 406-425.

Rhododendron farrerae Tate ex Sweet (Ericaceae), a Reconfirmed Species in Taiwan

Rhododendron farrerae Tate ex Sweet was first recorded in Taiwan by Kawakami in 1910. Since then, this species has been grouped with R. tashiroi Maxim. due to insufficient reports and specimens, and was eliminated from Flora of Taiwan in 1998. By examining all the specimens preserved in Taiwan herbaria and documents, we confirm that the native population of R. farrerae is actually distributed in southern Taiwan, ranging from Peitawushan to Tajen Township, in the southern part of the Central Mountain Range. The diagnostic character distinguishing R. farrerae from R. tashiroi and R. mariesii Hemsl. & E. H. Wils. is that R. tashiroi and R. mariesii bear 2-3 flowers from each bud at anthesis; in contrast, R. farrerae bears only one flower during the flowering period. We provide in this paper a detailed taxonomic treatment, morphological description, distribution map, line drawing, and a comparison table of these three species of Taiwan, together with photographs.
Graduate Institute of Bioresource, National Pingtung University of Science and Technology; Division of Forest Planning, Forest Bureau

Rhododendron farrerae Evergreen shrubs, 3-5 m tall, many branches, slightly horizontal, 2-4 layers. Young branchlets with shining brown-pilose or strigose hairs, and glabrous with age; winter buds brown-villous. Leaves crowded at ends of branches, opposite or 3 verticillate, coriaceous; blades elliptic-ovate, 2-4.5 cm long, 1-2 cm wide, the apex acute to acuminate and terminating into a gland or an awn, cuneate at the base, the margins entire, young leaf ciliate; mid-vein concave on the surface and promote at the lower surface, upper surface glabrous, lower surface with reticulate nervulets, glabrous except sparsely hirsute on midrib; young leaves clothed with brown pilose or strigose, glaucenscent; petiole 3-5 mm long, pilose, grooved on upper surface. Flower-bud terminal, single, scales orbicular, ovate, ciliate and densely brown pilose on the middle of outside; flower terminal, solitary, bloom and sprout at the same time; pedicels densely brown pilose, 10-12 mm long at fruiting; calyx pilose; corolla pale rose-purple, widely funnel-shaped, 2-2.5 cm long and 3-3.5 cm in diam., corolla lobe oblanceolate to obovate, with a line-like spot at the upper three corolla-lobe; stamens 10, filaments flattened, glabrous, irregular, shorter than corolla; anthers oblong, porus dehiscence, introrse; ovary ovate, densely clothed with pilose; style 2-2.5 cm long, equal or slightly longer than corolla, glabrous; stigma capitates, slightly lobed. Capsules narrowly ovoid, ovate, 8-10 mm long, 5-6 mm wide, clothed with appressed brown hairs. Seed elliptic to spindled, ca. 1.5 mm long, 0.5 mm wide, acute to acuminate on both sides. We gratefully thank Dr. Goro Kokubugata, Curator of theTsukuba Botancial Garden, for providing specimens andphotos of Rhododendron tashiroi and Y. P. Liu for R. mariesii.We also greatly appreciate C. K. Fu for providing the line drawing. 日本學者Kawakamii 早在1910年記錄丁香杜鵑 (Rhododendron farrerae) 分布於臺灣。此段期間，由於缺乏足夠文獻與標本，本植物一直認定為大武杜鵑 (R. tashiroi) 並於1998年從臺灣植物誌刪除。經查閱貯存之標本與資料，可以確認丁香杜鵑確實分布於臺灣南部中央山脈南端，從北大武山至台東縣達仁鄉。本種與大武杜鵑及守城滿山紅最主要的區別在於本種花頂生於枝條且僅1 朵花，大武杜鵑及守城滿山紅則2-3 朵花叢生於枝條。本文提供丁香杜鵑詳細的分類處理、形態描述、分布圖、手繪圖、照片及3 種近似種形態比較表，以供分類參考。

Pseudoconyza Cuatrec. (Asteraceae), a Newly Recorded Genus for the Flora of Taiwan

Pseudoconyza viscosa (Mill.) D’Arcy (Asteraceae) was recently found in lowlands of southern Taiwan. This represents a new record not only for this species but also for the genus on this island. In this study Pseudoconyza viscosa is described. A distribution map, line drawings and photographs of this species are also provided.

Tetrahydrofurfuryl Alcohol (THFA) Pulping of Rice Straw

A 80~95% solution of tetrahydrofurfuryl alcohol (THFA) added with 0.15~0.5% catalytic hydrochloric acid (HCl) was used to pulp rice straw. The pulping conditions applied for organosolv digestions of the straw at atmospheric pressure and 120℃ cooking for 4 h. The characteristics of the digestion, chemical properties of the resulting pulp, and the handsheet physical properties were evaluated. As for the pulp yields, the method has high delignification specificity, at kappa number 20, the yield was ca. 60%, about 15~20% higher than the traditional alkaline pulping method. Furthermore, with increasing THFA concentrations, efficacies of delignification also increased. Increasing the catalyst dosage also caused an increase in delignification. At an 120℃ cooking rate of delignification are not so appreciable, high yield were retained. If cooking temperatures were increased to 130 and 150℃, although even higher delignification rates were achievable, but the yield decreased as well. During the cooking the dissolution of carbohydrate were low, at most 23%, consisted of mostly hemicelluloses, which was as high as 78% of the dissolved carbohydrates. The optimal conditions of the THFA/HCl cooking applied 95% THFA, 0.50% HCl, temperature of 120℃, and cooking time of 240 min. Residue lignin in the resulting pulp were low, and can be bleached to high brightness easily with conventional bleaching sequence. If, however, energy and operation efficiency was a primary consideration, then a procedural heating scheme could be employed. The physical properties of the THFA pulp handsheets were inferior to those of the kraft pulp. The main reason was the damage to cellulose sustained during the acidic cooking condition.

Atmospheric pressure THFA pulping of rice strawOne hundred g (oven-dry mass) of the 3 cm rice straw segments were place in a round-bottom flask and added with 80~95% THFA in water solution having differing amounts of catalyst (HCl, 0.1~0.5%). Adjusting the liquor to material ratio to 10 and 12 (kg L-1), and carrying out digestion at 120℃ for 4 h respectively. After cooking, the pulp was washed thoroughly with water and a 2% solution of NaOH at 70℃ to obtian the pulp. Yields were then determined. In order to compare the delignification rates and yields, digestions at 130 and 150℃were also carried out. All test data shown are the average of triplicate analyses.Evaluation of pulp propertiesAfter pulping, the washed pulp were subjected to chemical analyses, including the kappa number (TAPPI T236 om-85), ash (TAPPI T211 om-93), alcohol-benzene extractives (TAPPI T204 os-76), holocellulose (the Wise method, as stipulated by the Japan Wood Association, 1985), cellulose and hemicellulose content (JIS P9001), and lignin (TAPPI T222 om-88). All test data shown are the average of triplicate analyses.

Relationships among selected wood properties of 20-year-old Taiwania (Taiwania cryptomerioides) trees

The relationships between bending properties, compressive strength, tracheid length, microfibril angle, and ring characteristics of 20-year-old Taiwania (Taiwania cryptomerioides Hay.) trees were examined. The trees came from different thinning and pruning treatments, but the practices showed no significant effect on the investigated properties. The results showed that based on comparison with the literature, plantation-grown immature Taiwania have noticeably lower average strength properties than mature trees of the same species. Wood density and bending and compressive strengths were not related to either tracheid length or microfibril angle in young Taiwania. There were positive relationships between bending strength and compressive strength. The wood density, ring width, earlywood width, earlywood density, and latewood percentage were the most important predictors of strength by simple linear regressions. The wood density and ring width/ earlywood width may be considered as indicators for assessing the bending strength, while wood density and latewood percentage were the best predictors of compressive strength by multiple linear regressions.

Chih-MingChiuTaiwan Forestry Research InstituteDivision of Forest Managementcmchiu@tfri.gov.tw

methodsThe study plantation was planted at a rate of 1750 trees/ha(initial spacing) in 1980. Thinning (811–1528 trees/ha) and pruning (3.6–4.5 m) treatments were implemented in 1990.The study site is located in the no. 12 compartment of the Liukuei Experimental Forest of the Taiwan ForestryResearch Institute (TFRI), Kaohsiung Country, southern Taiwan. The diameter and height of each tree on the 27 smallplots were investigated and measured. A mean diameter from the trees was selected from each plot. In total, 27 meandiameter trees from the stands were selected and cut for testing. The average diameter at breast height (DBH) oftest sampled trees ranged from 23.53 to 28.03 cm. The average tree heights varied from 15.2 m to 15.8 m. (Fig. 1) These trees were harvested on February 14 and 15, 2001, and were about 20 years old. One 50-cm-long log was cut from each tree where its DBH was about 80–130cm above the ground. One crosssectional disk (10 cm thick) was cut from each sample log. A diametrical strip (passing through the pith) was sawn from each disk in the same direction. The strip was cut from the disk for drilling resistance, tracheid length, and microfibril angle measurements.In addition, a piece of cant (passing through pith) was sawn from each log (40 cm long) in an east–west direction.Then, they were further band-sawn into specimens by the cant sawing method, as shown in Fig. 2.Only the nine outermost growth rings (about 3 specimens and diametrical strips) near the bark of the trees weretaken and used to assess the selected wood properties. This is because the trees were sampled 9 years after thinning and pruning treatments. The cambium age of the sample specimens was 12–20 years old (from different silvicultural regimes).All small clear specimens [32 (long) × 1.5 (wide) ×1.5 cm (thick) and 3 (long) × 1.5 (wide) × 1.5 cm (thick)] were cut from the 40-cm-long cant for the bending and compressive tests. Thus, more than a total of 324 specimens were measured (27 trees × more than 6 specimens × 2 tests) for two strength tests. All specimens were conditioned in acontrolled environment room at 20°C and 65% relative humidity such that the wood had a moisture content of 12%.methodsA commercially available ultrasonic testing tool was used to evaluate the ultrasonic wave velocity and dynamicmodulus of elasticity. Then, specimens [32 (long) × 1.5 (wide) × 1.5 cm (thick)] were also measured using an ultrasonicwave technique for longitudinal transmission; the ultrasonic wave apparatus (Sylvatest-duo, 22kHz; Swiss Products) included a transmitting transducer and receiving transducer. The ultrasonic wave velocity (V) and the dynamicmodulus of elasticity (DMOE) were calculated in this experiment.All diametric strips of Taiwania were subjected to the drilling resistance test, tracheid length, and microfibril anglemeasurement. These strips were chosen from same product lot and experimental methods were taken from the sametechniques used in previous studies.6,17 Resistograph measurements were made on specimens (strips, at ca. 12% moisture content) in the radial direction.The annual ring contours were marked on a chart for tree ring and control parameters, including the average tree-ringwidth (RW), earlywood width (EW), latewood width (LW), tree-ring density (RD), earlywood density (EWD), latewooddensity (LWD), highest density (HD), lowest density (LD), and latewood percentage (LWP) in a ring.Bending and compressive methods for wood strength determination were in accordance with CNS 45420 and CNS453,21 respectively. Static bending tests were conducted in accordance with the center-loading method for specimensusing a universal test machine (UH-10A; Shimadzu, Kyoto, Japan). All specimens were loaded flatwise, and the spanwas 26cm in the bending tests. The proportional limit, ultimate load, and deflection were obtained from the load–deflection curves, and the modulus of elasticity (MOE) and modulus of rupture (MOR) were calculated. Moreover, thecompressive strength in the longitudinal direction to the grain of a test specimen was evaluated.

Moreover, thecompressive strength in the longitudinal direction to the grain of a test specimen was evaluated.
Relationships among selected wood properties of 20-year-old Taiwania (Taiwania cryptomerioides) trees

From the IPCC website: The CRU Global Climate Dataset available through the IPCC DDC consists of a multi-variate 0.01º latitude by 0.01º longitude resolution mean monthly climatology for global land areas, excluding Antarctica, strictly constrained to the period 1961-1990. The mean 1961-1990 climatology comprises a suite of eleven surface variables: precipitation (PRE) and wet-day frequency (WET); mean, maximum and minimum temperature (TMP, TMX, TMN); diurnal temperature range (DTR); vapour pressure (VAP;) global radiation (RAD;) cloud cover (CLD); frost frequency (FRS); and wind speed (WND). The mean climate surfaces have been constructed from a new dataset of station 1961-1990 climatological normals, numbering between 19,800 (precipitation) and 3615 (windspeed). The station data were interpolated as a function of latitude, longitude and elevation using thin-plate splines. The accuracy of the interpolations are assessed using cross-validation and by comparison with other climatologies. this data-set has been decsribed in: New,M., Hulme,M. and Jones,P.D. (1999) Representing twentieth century space-time climate variability. Part 1: development of a 1961-90 mean monthly terrestrial climatology J.Climate 12, 829-856.

Format (ASCII) The first and second lines of the file contain information on the grid size, for example: grd_sz xmin ymin xmax ymax n_cols n_rows n_months missing 0.01 120.0309121 21.8442559 122.0609121 25.5542559 371 203 12 -9999 This is followed by 12 monthly grids that are n_cols by n_rows in size. Each record contains n_cols (=371) columns longitude values, format 720i5, starting at xmin (= 120.0309121 deg) and ending at xmax (=122.0609121 deg) The first record starts at January, ymax (=25.5542559 deg) and the last record is the row for December, ymin (=21.8442559 deg). Co-ordinates represent the centre of each grid cell. Missing values (Antarctica, oceans and major inland water bodies) are assigned integer values of -9999. Units: degrees KProblems have come to light through user feedback and routine quality control in the Climatic Research Unit (during work towards the construction of an updated version of the 1961-1990 climatology). These problems range from systematic errors (for example, due to incorrect units being assumed for a whole country) to single-station errors. Errors at single stations have varying importance depending on the density of the surrounding network. Where the network is sparse, the station error will influence a larger area because of its greater spatial influence during the interpolation. Systematic errors arise because of varying reporting methods and units adopted by different national meteorological agencies (and other data contributors). The methods used to standardise data to a common format are discussed by New et al. (1999). Some problems are due to shortcomings in the standardisation methods used. In addition, misunderstandings (or a lack of information) about the units in which data were supplied means that the incorrect (or no) standardisation was used. The majority of problems/errors identified to date are due to confusion of units and shortcomings in the standardisation towards the use of common units. The climate variable with the largest potential for confusion is wind speed. Not only do reporting units vary between metres per second, miles per hour and knots; anemometer heights can vary greatly from the desired 10m (e.g. between 2m and 20m). The following (variable) gridded files are known to have either systematic or significant single station errors which potential users need to be aware of. The errors are present in the mean-monthly 1961-90 terrestrial climatology files and are thus propagated into the gridded 1901-1995 monthly time-series. The affected part of the globe is defined where possible. * Greenland all variables The interior of Greenland is poorly covered by meteorological observation. This coupled with the presence of the high elevation ice cap makes interpolation of climate normals very difficult due to the potential for unusual lapse rates. It is likely that significant bias may be present with all variables for the interior of the landmass (e.g. diurnal temperature range and precipitation too high).

Dormancy and germination in seeds of the medicinal Asian tree species Phellodendron amurense var. wilsonii (Rutaceae)--Effect of stratification on germination

The effects of alternating temperatures, cold stratification and gibberellic acid (GA3) on seed germination of Phellodendron amurense var. wilsonii were investigated. Incubation at 35/10°C or stratification at 4°C prior to incubation of freshly harvested seeds significantly increased germination percentages from 5% to 87%. Germination percentage was increased only slightly in intact seeds treated with up to 2000 ppm GA3. However, partial removal of the seed coat by mechanical scarification plus GA3 resulted in a drastic increase in both germination percentage and rate. Storage in liquid nitrogen for Ã¢ÂÂ¥ one month enhanced germination percentage, and the beneficial action was due to cracking of the seed coat. Embryos excised from their enclosing tissues and embryos surrounded by endosperm germinated to a much higher percentage than intact seeds, indicating that the water-permeable seed coat plays a mechanical role in preventing radicle protrusion in nontreated intact seeds. Seeds required three months of cold stratification to break dormancy, and GA3 promoted seed germination. We conclude that seeds of P. amurense var. wilsonii have physiological dormancy.
Shun-YingChenTaiwan Forestry Research InstituteAssisant Researcher53 Nan-hai. Rd., TaipeiTaipeiTaiwansychen@tfri.gov.tw

Content: Shun-YingChenTaiwan Forestry Research InstituteAssisant Researcher53 Nan-hai. Rd., TaipeiTaipeiTaiwansychen@tfri.gov.tw

Seed collection and preparationMature black fruits of P. amurense var. wilsonii were harvested from Taiping Mountain (24Â°30'N, 121Â°29'E), Ilan County, northeastern Taiwan, at an elevation of 1600 m in September 2004. The fruits are very oily and aromatic. Fruits harvested from natural forests or plantations should be rapidly transported to the handling place to avoid decreases in viability of the seedlots due to high temperatures in the transport-containers (Chien personal observation). Each fruit contains 3~6 seeds (average 5), but some of them are empty. Fruits were macerated by hand in water, and the empty seeds were floated off and discarded. The clean sunken seeds were used for subsequent treatments. The black seed (4~6 mm long and 2~3 mm wide) consists of the seed coat and a large dicotyledonous embryo surrounded by a small amount endosperm (figure 1). The spatulate embryo (Martin, 1946) is fully developed with a mean (Â± SE) embryo length : seed length ratio of 0.83 Â± 0.02 (n = 15), and it does not grow within the seed before the radicle emerges. Seed moisture content was determined with three replicates of 20 seeds and calculated on a fresh-weight basis after oven drying for 17 hours at 103Â°C (ISTA, 1999).ImbibitionEach of 20 non-scarified and scarified (cut at the point away from embryonic axis) seeds were weighed individually to the nearest 0.1 mg at time 0 and after incubation at ambient laboratory temperature (~24Â°C) for 24 hours on Whatman no. 1 filter paper in Petri dishes moistened with distilled water. Percentage water uptake was calculated as follows: %Ws = [(Wi -Wd)/Wd] X100, where Ws = increase in seed mass, Wi = seed mass after imbibition and Wd = initial seed mass (Hidayati et al., 2000). Embryos were excised from each of 30 imbibed seeds, and then three replications of 10 embryos were weighed to nearest 0.1 mg before and after drying them in an oven at 50Â°C for 24 hours. Percentage embryo moisture content was calculated from these data as described above for seeds.Effect of stratification on germinationFor warm followed by cold stratification, freshly harvested seeds were placed in polyethylene bags (0.04 mm in thickness) with moist sphagnum and sealed, and then they were warm-stratified for 2, 4, 6 and 8 weeks at an alternating temperature regime of 30/20Â°C with 12 hours of fluorescent light (80~100 Mole m-2 s-1; hereafter light) at the higher temperature. These warm-stratified seeds were then given 4, 8, 12, 16 or 20 weeks of cold moist stratification at 4Â°C. A cold stratification treatment without a warm treatment was also carried out on fresh seeds in moist sphagnum for 4, 8, 12, 16 and 20 weeks prior to the seeds being subjected to germination tests. Each stratification treatment consisted of three replications of 100 seeds each. Moisture content (MC) of the sphagnum in both warm and cold stratification treatments was about 400% of its dry mass. Germination tests using fresh seeds were performed in germination chambers at constant 25Â°C and at 35/10, 30/20 and 25/15Â°C (12/12 hours) in light during the higher temperature. Germination tests of warm- followed by cold-stratified seeds or of cold-stratified seeds only were performed at 30/20Â°C, i.e. same temperature as that for warm stratification. Sphagnum served as the germination medium. Germination, i.e. radicle at least 5 mm long, was recorded weekly. Results were expressed as percentage germination after 12 weeks and as the mean germination time (MGT) in days. MGT is a measure of the rate (speed) of germination and of the sharpness of the germination peak: MGT = (total niti)/Gt, where ni = number of seeds germinated in ti days from the beginning of the test and Gt = total number of germinated seeds at the end of the test (Kotowski, 1962).Statistical analysisRadical protrusion data were transformed to percentages based on number of treated seeds. Germination (mean Â± SE) was calculated, and means were compared by two-way analysis of variance (ANOVA) and by least significant difference (LSD) at the 5% level of significance (SAS, 2004).

Production of camptothecin and hinokitiol by plant cell culture of Camptotheca acuminata, Nothapodytes nimmoniana and Cupressaceae spp.(5/5)-Tissue cultre of Cupressaceae.

CPT-11, semi-synthesized from CPT contained in the plants of Camptotheca acuminata, is an anticancer drug and an inhabitant of HIV. Hinokitiol, contained in heartwood of Cupressaceae family, is an effective natural antimicrobial compound, with low toxicity. It has been extensively used in clinical products, cosmetics, and food. These two components are very expensive for the low yield producing from plants. Instead of culturing plant, cell culture is a powerful alternative way to produce these two components in bioreactor. In this project we try to establish a cell culture system and determine the concentrations of components in the cultures.
Dr.Shu-HwaChangTaiwan Forest Research InstituteAssociate Scientist53 Nan Hai Rd,Taipei10066Taiwan02-23039978#200302-23374766shchang@tfri.gov.tw

1.Investigation of hinokitiol contentSeeds and twigs were collected from different species of Calocedrus formsana, Chamaecyparis formosensis and C. obtusa. Seedlings of C. acuminata and N. nimmoniana were obtained in green house. Leave and stem were collected from three species.2. In vitro shoots and callus culture.The callus of Calocedrus formsana, Chamaecyparis formosensis and C. obtuse were subcultured every 30 days and the seedlings were subcultured every 1.5-2 month.3. High hinokitiol content of callus and seedling selected.The calli and in vitro shoots (1.5-2g fresh weight) of Calocedrus formsana, Chamaecyparis formosensis and C. obtuse were dried,The sample were freeze dried and ground to a fine powder. The powder was extracted with methanol and were extracted with methanol and added BF2 to form β-thujaplicin BF2 complex and were analyed by HPLC and GC-mass to evaluation hinotiol content. The sample were freeze dried and ground to a fine powder. The powder was extracted with methanol and . were analyzed by reverse phase HPLC on a C18 column.4..The effect of sugar composition on hinokitiol content of cell cultureThe cell culture of 3 species were obtained by using the method which obtained last year. The callus were cultured in 250ml Erlenmeyer flasks with 50ml medium supplemented with NAA or 2,4-D to obtain suspension cultures. Cell suspension were subcultured every 2 weeks and in dark. Different sugar (glucose, sucrose, maltose ) concentration and composition were replaced sucrose to test the effect of secondary metabolites production. Three ml of cell cultures were harvested after 7,14,21,28,35,42d for HPLC analysis and the cell volume, cell color were recorded.5.The effect of MJ, AgNO3Cell cultures of 3 species were obtained as above methods. All the precursors (methyl jasmonate，jasmonatic acid，AgNO3) were dissolved in water and directly added, by filtering (0.22μM), to the cell suspension (2.5g of cell FW in 20ml of medium) on day 0, 7 and 10. Three ml of cell cultures were harvested after 7,14,21,28,35,42d for HPLC analysis and the cell volume, cell color were recorded.

台灣二葉松地上部生物量及碳貯存之估算

The study was research on estimation of the aboveground biomass and carbon storage of 34 year old Taiwan red pine ( Pinus taiwanensis ) plantation in Lishan area located in central Taiwan. According to the DBH distribution of stand, allometric equation established by stem analysis data of sample trees, and the value of convert coefficient built by the least squares method. Furthermore, elemental analyzer was used to analyze carbon content of the sample taken from trees harvested. The results show that estimated aboveground biomass were 178.33±22.13tonha-1 by DBH-biomass-volume equations and related convert coefficients, and 81.1% was in stem. Current aboveground biomass production were 1.9±0.3tonha-1yr-1 by volume increment formula. In terms of carbon concentration, there are different among different tissues. The mean values rank as：bark（49.4±1.3﹪）≒live branch（49.0±0.3﹪）≒leaf（48.5±0.5﹪）＞dead branch（47.9±0.7﹪）＞stem（45.9±0.7﹪）,and carbon concentration of living tree is 46.9±0.1％. Meanwhile, carbon storage in aboveground of trees estimated were 81.6±9.9tonha-1 , and current carbon sequestration were 0.9±0.3 tonha-1yr-1, that means 3.3±1.0 co2 tonha-1yr-1 were sequestrated into the aboveground parts of Taiwan red pine plantation .

研究資料為宜蘭大學自然資源學系林世宗教授擁有,如需要使用本報告之任何原始資料,請與林世宗教授聯繫,於獲得同意後方可使用原始資料進行研究或作為其他用途.

材料與方法試驗地位於大甲溪事業區44、45林班之34年生二葉松造林地，海拔2050m，南向坡，設9個40mx25m生物量調查樣區，調查樹高2公尺以上之林木測量其胸徑。採分層取樣選取二葉松樣木，依調查資料之胸徑級分布，每徑級取5~6株樣木，共分5級，台灣二葉松共取28株，選定之樣木伐倒後測量其樹高與地上部生物調查。(Ⅰ)、生物量調查自樣木上先取所有枯枝秤重後將冠層等分為上、中、下三層，分別秤各層之枝、葉鮮重，樣木樹幹則依樹幹解析方式分段秤鮮重，再自各層分別逢機取枝葉次樣本，樹幹則取至胸高、樹冠基部及樹冠中部之圓盤次樣本分離樹皮及木材，秤鮮重後再以70℃烘至絕乾重，計算各樣木之葉、枝、枯枝、樹皮及木材乾鮮比，復由樣木各部位鮮重轉換為乾重，總加為樣木乾重，即樣木地上部生物量，並進行Duncan’s檢定各部位之碳濃度之差異。(Ⅱ)、台灣二葉松樹幹解析自生物量調查樣木中取20株林木，依樹幹解析方法，於各高度取3-5公分厚之橫斷面圓盤，陰乾後經刨光磨平後經電子掃描建立影像檔，利用德國Ligno vision軟體分析量測各圓盤樹輪寬，以smalian分段求積法計算各樣木材積及其胸徑生長量。(Ⅲ)、樣木各部位物質碳濃度分析與樣木碳含量估算自不同徑級之9株樣木中以各部位次樣本經烘乾(70℃)再以切碎磨粉過篩(≦0.2mm)裝袋密封，以元素分析儀（HERAEUS Vario, EL-Ⅲ, Germany）分析碳濃度，由樣木各部位碳濃度與乾重，總加為樣木碳含量，樣木平均碳濃度則以樣木各部位乾重為加權值乘其碳濃度計算。(Ⅳ)、相關性分析與林分碳存量推估就不同徑級林木之生長參數(DBH、H)、林木生物量、材積等進行相關性分析，以最小平方法(least squares method)估算建立各項參數之轉換係數(convert coefficient)值，包括地上部生物量與樹幹生物量比值，即擴張係數（expansion factor, EFabove）、樹幹生物量與其連皮材積比值，即立木密度（stem density）與立木木材密度（basic density），即木材乾重與去皮材積之比值。並採用相對生長迴歸式與材積轉換係數推估台灣二葉松林木地上部生物量及碳存量。

Clonal Test of Taxus mairei by Using Water Culture-HPLC analysis

Three month-old rooted cuttings of Taxus mairei clones T1, Nj11, K3, and Wx were grown hydroponically in 1/10 and 1/20 strength of Johnson&rsquos nutrient solution (JS) for 6, 9 and 11 months at which time (Sep, Dec and Feb) they were sampled and analyzed since March 2000. Dry weight and the yields of 10-deacetyl baccatin III (10-DAB), taxol, and total taxanes per plant at 3 harvesting times were not significantly different between two strengths of JS, only the 11 month-old plants produced greater taxol in 1/20 JS. Great variations of these two parameters in 3 organs (leaves, stems and roots) of plants among 4 clones were found. Wx grew poorly and produced little taxanes. Nj11 grew fast with the greatest taxanes. T1 had growth rate similar to K3, but with greater taxanes. Nj11 was a 10-DAB rich clone, a 11 month-old plant produced 5.83 mg. Whereas T1 was the taxol rich clone, it produced 1.16 mg per plant. Usually 10-DAB was rich in needles, while taxol was rich in roots. However, T1&rsquos needles contained taxol greater than its roots. The concentrations of both 10-DAB and taxol achieved the greatest amount in Dec than the other two harvesting months. Although 11 month-old plants gave the greatest biomass, the taxanes increased a little when compared to 9 month-old ones. Since most of potted plants died and grew poorly during the culture period, suggesting that water culture is a good tool to rapidly evaluate the clonal performance of Taiwan yew.
Dr.Shu-HwaChangTaiwan Forest Research InstituteAssociate Scientist53 Nan Hai Rd,Taipei10066Taiwan02-23039978#200302-23374766shchang@tfri.gov.tw

Dr.Cheng-KuenHoTaiwan Forest Research InstituteAssociate Scientist53 Nan Hai Rd,Taipei10066Taiwan02-23039978#200202-23374766ckho@tfri.gov.twUser

1.MaterialFour clones of Taxus mairei were selected. Rooted cuttings were obtained after 3 month of cuttings on Dec 1999. They were transferred into pots in the greenhouse for 3 months. The volume, fresh weight, and dry weight of plants were measured. 32 plants of each clones were random selected as materials in this experiment.Four clonal plants aged 2-year old coded as T1, Nj11, K4 and Wx, whose mother trees were collected at Hualien, Shinchu, Lishan, and Daulien, respectively. Rooted cuttings of 4 clones were obtained on 12 December 1996 after cutting for 3 months in the greenhouse at Taipei Botanic Garden. They were transplanted into plastic pots (4 × 4 × 21 cm in length, width and height) containing with 1:1 ratio of vermiculite and peat and 1 g nutrient coat. After nursing in greenhouse for 3 months (from March 12 to 28, 1997), they were removed from pots, rinsed the roots with tap water. Each shoot and root parts of a plant was immersed into 500-mL beaker containing 450 mL, respectively, and the weight gains after subtracting the water weight were acted as the volume of each part.. To understand the dry weights of 4 clones, another 4 plants of each were sampled and oven dried at 70℃ for two days.2.Culture EnvironmentThe plants were grown in a shelter with 60% light off at Taipei Botanical Garden. The averaged light intensities during from March 5 to March 10 2000 were recorded (Dataloger L1-GOR, USA). The light intensity was about 30% of full sun light at 10 am in a open area next to the culture area.Dataloger L1-GOR, USA3.Taxanes analysisFor the quantification of taxanes in tissue. The tissue (1 g) was freeze dried and ground to a fine powder with a mortar and pestle. The powdered tissue was extracted 2 times with 20 ml of methanol by sonication, each extraction for 30 min. After sonication, the combined methanolic extract was transfer into glass tube (16 mm x 100 mm) and evaporated to dryness at 40℃ in vacuum evaporator (Zymark Crop., Hopkinton, MA, USA). For analysis, 1 ml methanol was added to the residue and vortexed for 20 seconds, the mixture was filtered through a 0.2 μm filter (Whatman Inc., Fairfield, NJ), The filtrate solution transferred to clean glass vials for analysis.Isocratic analytical HPLC was performed on a Perkin elmer HPLC system with a 2996 system photodiode-array detector. (Milford. MA, USA) using a Chromolith Performance RP-18 monolithic column {5μm, 150x4.6mm}(Supelco Disscovery, Bellefonte, PA, USA). The mobile phase for alkaloid elution was 0.03M methanol:acetonitrile:H2O (20:38:42), at a flow rate of 1 ml/min with a sample size of 10μl and UV detection at 230nm Retention times for DB, BC and taxol were 3.3 min, 5.2min and 21.6 min, . The quantification of peak area was based on the calibration using a external standard of DB, BC and taxol (Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA). 10-DAB, taxol and total taxanes (the sum of 10-DAB, baccatin, 10-deacetyl taxol, cephalomanine, taxol and 7-epi-10-deacetyltaxol) was determined following the procedure and the same HPLC as reported by Ho et al. (2001). Only the yields of 10-DAB, BC, taxol, and total taxanes (the sum of 6 components) per plant were analyzed by SAS to evaluate the changes during the culture period.Perkin Elmer HPLC4.Data AnalysisPlant growth increase in fresh and dry weight and taxane concentrations was determined after 6 months (5 Sep. 1997), 9 months (5 Dec. 1997) and 11 month (2 Feb. 1998) in culture. At data collection date 4 plants of each clone were randomly taken from each vessel. Since taxane concentration and water content in different parts of a plant varied greatly, plants were separated as needle, stems (the total weight of needles and stem = shoot weight) and root parts, and were weighed respectively. Plants of each part were collected, grinded with methanol and determined concentrations of taxanes each as described below. The extracted residues were oven dried at 70℃ for two days as to be dry weights. Taxane yields per parts of a plant were calculated as the concentration of each component (ppm) times its dry weight, and then the total taxane yield per plant was obtained by adding together of all the yields of each part. The data were analyzed by GLM, SAS (SAS users Guide 1985) to evaluate the effect of the different clones, the concentrations of JS solution, and the culture period on the growth and taxane yield per plants.

Preservation and mildew control of wood materials

木材本身是一種高分子有機聚合體，構成其主成分的纖維素、半纖維素與木質素等極易受到外在環境因子的生物如腐朽菌、昆蟲等危害，此結果不但降低了木材的使用價值，也造成了極鉅的生命財產損失。 以銅、鉻、砷元素為主的鉻化砷酸銅（Chromated Copper Arsenate, CCA）是一種全世界普遍使用的木材防腐藥劑，其效用可使木材在大部分的環境下免於昆蟲與腐朽菌的危害。然而，由於環境污染的問題，近年來這些防腐藥劑在有些國家已經被禁止使用。因此，不含鉻與砷的防腐藥劑與低污染性的防腐藥劑如銅烷基銨化合物（Alkaline Copper Quats, ACQ）與當耐力CY（Tanalith CY, TCY）等在美國已逐步的被開發與應用。銅烷基銨化合物與當耐力CY處理材之耐腐朽性與抗白蟻性是由於其藥劑中之金屬離子在木材中產生固著或沉澱，因此其藥劑之淋溶性亦將影響到環境之污染問題。然而，迄今並無標準之試驗方法來評估此類防腐藥劑之固著性，因此在此類防腐藥劑應用於我國木材加工業前，實有必要瞭解其處理材之耐腐朽性、抗白蟻性與藥劑淋溶性，以降低或減少其對於環境之影響。所以，本研究擬進行銅烷基銨化合物與當耐力CY處理材之室內與田野試驗，由試驗結果可以提供我國木材加工業生產更符合環保與安全性之木製品。又木材極易受到環境溫濕度影響，且無法避免遭受霉菌等微生物之危害，因而產生腐朽並降低木材之品質，本研究計畫擬採用聚對二甲苯（polypara-xylylenes）真空鍍膜技術與幾丁聚醣塗裝等方法以進行木材表面處理，期能藉由高分子聚合物之沉積於木材表面，以改善木質材料之吸濕性與易滋生霉菌等缺點，藉以達到改善木材表面性質之目的，進而確保持木製的綠色產品能長保如新之目標，克服木材表面之霉害劣化，進而延長其使用年限。
Dr.Chin-YinHwangTaiwan Forestry Reserach InstituteSenior Scientist53 Nan-Hai RdTaipeiTaiwan100ROC886-2-23039978#3723886-2-23077306chinyin@tfri.gov.tw

新型水溶性木材防腐藥劑之效能及其對於環境之影響1.腐朽及蟲害情形之檢測：定期前往福山、蓮華池與中埔等三研究中心進行取樣各種處理材5支，觀測與紀錄各種處理試材外表遭受腐朽及蟲害情形。2.重量損失率測定：將前述試材攜回試驗室，並將其放置於105℃烘箱乾燥一天後，放置於乾燥皿中冷卻，測定其重量之減輕量。3.重金屬流失率測定：將前述乾燥試材以粉碎機打成粉末，再秤量1g木粉並壓製成圓盤，而後再以x射線元素測試儀測定其重金屬含量變化情形。4.靜曲強度試驗：以萬能強度試驗機測試各處理材埋置後經時之力學性質變化情形。x射線元素測試儀、萬能強度試驗機。幾丁聚醣應用於木質材料霉害防除之探討1.幾丁聚醣處理木材之防霉性能評估：取實際篩選、純化之各種木材表面最具代表性之霉菌菌株（ Aspergillus niger, Aspergillus flavus, Trichoderma viride），分別接種於各試驗材料表面，而後將處理後之試材置入25℃培養箱中，以PDA培養基進行霉菌培養試驗，藉以評估各種防霉藥劑之抗霉效能。2.幾丁聚醣處理試材耐久性之評估：分為室內人工試驗及戶外曝露試驗方式進行耐久性評估。3.幾丁聚醣處理木材之性質分析與測定：包括：顏色變化、、接觸角、顯微結構、防霉性能、表面化學官能基之評估與分析。人工耐候試驗機、紅外線光譜儀、色差計、接觸角計、掃描式電子顯微鏡。聚對二甲苯鍍膜處理應用於木材表面性質之改良1.適用於木材表面處理聚對二甲苯種類之篩選及最佳鍍膜膜厚之評估。2.鍍膜處理材之顏色變化、潤性能（接觸角）、顯微結構、化學官能基之分析與測定。3.聚對二甲苯鍍膜處理試材耐久性之評估：分為室內人工試驗（UVB-313燈管加速照光劣化）及戶外曝露試驗方式進行耐久性評估。人工耐候試驗機、紅外線光譜儀、色差計、接觸角計。

Litter production, decomposition and nutrient return of uplifted coral reef tropical forest

Four habitat types in a 10-ha permanent plot of an uplifted coral reef forest in southern Taiwan were chosen and subjected to systematic litterfall related processes. Ebenaceae and Euphorbiaceae were the dominant families. The common species in the four habitats were Diospyros maritime, Ficus benjamina and Melanolepis multiglandulosa. Habitat I on the flat terrace was dominated by Bischofia javanica and Palaquium formosanum; habitat II on the ridge of exposed coral reef was dominated by Aglaia formosana and Pouteria obovata; habitat III on the sedimentary basin was dominated by Macaranga tanariu; habitat IV at the bottom of valley was dominated by Pisonia umbellifera. Litter productions, decomposition processes and nutrient returns were monitored over a 12-month period in the four habitats. Bulk litter was gathered from traps for monthly accession of litterfall. Mixed-species litter bags containing equal portions of the individual species were used to measure the decomposition constants of the leaf litter. Fresh and decomposing litters were analyzed for C, N, P, Ca, Mg, K and Na. Experimental results indicated that mean monthly litterfall in all the habitats displayed a marked seasonal pattern, with spring troughs and summer, autumn and winter peaks associated with the typhoon and monsoon seasons. The annual litterfall ranged from 6.98 to 9.13 Mg ha1 year1, is within but in the higher range for tropical forests. The litterfall production in habitats I and IV was significantly ( p < 0.05) exceeding that in habitats II and III. This phenomenon probably occurs because the dominant tree species of habitat II are relatively adapted to strong wind, and the leaves survived for a long time on the exposed coral reef; meanwhile, habitat III comprised secondary forest which was dominated by early succession tree species with lower leaf area index and basal area than those in other habitats. Significant differences in initial C concentration in the leaf litter were observed in the four habitats. Carbon release from the leaf litter was fastest in habitat IV, while the thin and less rigid leaves without prominent skeletal tissues of Pisonia umbellifera are easily decomposed. The mass and nutrients in the leaf litter could be arranged sequentially in order of decreasing mobility: Ca > Mg = N > Na > K > P > mass > C. Carbon was returned to the forest floor in the highest amount, and the next element was Ca which ranged from 196 to 324 kg ha1 year1. Surprisingly, the annual returns of Ca significantly exceeded those of N, and differed significantly from those of other tropical forests

Establishment and application for empirical equations of exponential type to estimate design hyetographs

In this study, theoretical analyses of empirical equation of exponential type to estimate design hyetographs, verification of these type equations, and application of empirical equations of design hyetographs in Taiwan were carried out. An example of estimating 24-hour duration design hyetograph at Shanping of Taiwan was presented. ( published in Journal of slopeland hazard prevention, 4(1):1-10, 2005, Establishment and application for empirical equations of exponential type to estimate design hyetographs )

Tetrahydrofurfuryl Alcohol (THFA) Pulping of Rice Straw

A 80~95% solution of tetrahydrofurfuryl alcohol (THFA) added with 0.15~0.5% catalytic hydrochloric acid (HCl) was used to pulp rice straw. The pulping conditions applied for organosolv digestions of the straw at atmospheric pressure and 120℃ cooking for 4 h. The characteristics of the digestion, chemical properties of the resulting pulp, and the handsheet physical properties were evaluated. As for the pulp yields, the method has high delignification specificity, at kappa number 20, the yield was ca. 60%, about 15~20% higher than the traditional alkaline pulping method. Furthermore, with increasing THFA concentrations, efficacies of delignification also increased. Increasing the catalyst dosage also caused an increase in delignification. At an 120℃ cooking rate of delignification are not so appreciable, high yield were retained. If cooking temperatures were increased to 130 and 150℃, although even higher delignification rates were achievable, but the yield decreased as well. During the cooking the dissolution of carbohydrate were low, at most 23%, consisted of mostly hemicelluloses, which was as high as 78% of the dissolved carbohydrates. The optimal conditions of the THFA/HCl cooking applied 95% THFA, 0.50% HCl, temperature of 120℃, and cooking time of 240 min. Residue lignin in the resulting pulp were low, and can be bleached to high brightness easily with conventional bleaching sequence. If, however, energy and operation efficiency was a primary consideration, then a procedural heating scheme could be employed. The physical properties of the THFA pulp handsheets were inferior to those of the kraft pulp. The main reason was the damage to cellulose sustained during the acidic cooking condition.

Atmospheric pressure THFA pulping of rice strawOne hundred g (oven-dry mass) of the 3 cm rice straw segments were place in a round-bottom flask and added with 80~95% THFA in water solution having differing amounts of catalyst (HCl, 0.1~0.5%). Adjusting the liquor to material ratio to 10 and 12 (kg L-1), and carrying out digestion at 120℃ for 4 h respectively. After cooking, the pulp was washed thoroughly with water and a 2% solution of NaOH at 70℃ to obtian the pulp. Yields were then determined. In order to compare the delignification rates and yields, digestions at 130 and 150℃were also carried out. All test data shown are the average of triplicate analyses.Evaluation of pulp propertiesAfter pulping, the washed pulp were subjected to chemical analyses, including the kappa number (TAPPI T236 om-85), ash (TAPPI T211 om-93), alcohol-benzene extractives (TAPPI T204 os-76), holocellulose (the Wise method, as stipulated by the Japan Wood Association, 1985), cellulose and hemicellulose content (JIS P9001), and lignin (TAPPI T222 om-88). All test data shown are the average of triplicate analyses.

Validation of the Name Adiantum meishanianum (Pteridaceae), a Species Endemic to Taiwan

While investigating the fern called Adiantum meishanianum F. S. Hsu ex Y. C. Liu & W. L. Chiou (Pteridaceae), it was discovered that the name was not validly published because it had not appeared in an effectively published work. The name is validated herein; the holotype is deposited in HAST, and there are paratypes in TAIF, HAST, and SYSU.

DiagnosisThe present paper validates the name Adiantum meishanianum and designates a type specimen. As noted, the diagnosis provided by Hsu (1993) was never effectively published and is brief and in some parts erroneous. Therefore, we re-describe and present a full diagnosis and description of A. meishanianum herein.

Chemical constituents from the leaves of Machilus zuihoensis Hayata var. mushaensis (Lu) Y.C. Liu

One new lignan, machilolin-A (1), was isolated from the leaves of Machilus zuihoensis Hayata var. mushaensis (Lu) Y. C. Liu (Lauraceae), together with three known compounds, vanillin (2), -sitosterol (3) and stigmasterol (4). The structure of 1 was elucidated based on chemical analysis and spectral methods (IR, 1D and 2D NMR, HR-FAB-MS, EI-MS).
